reviewText:
I have seen a lot of D-Day events committed to film, but this one is AMAZING.
It is truly the best I have ever seen, and moved me to tears several times.
The last minute, about Eisenhower, was truly touching.  You must see this.

This is the best show I have seen on the d-day.  It doesn't end with the actual day but proceeds in what everyone went thru afterwards.  It was so well done and really captivated me.  I am buying it to give to my dad for Father's day.

Both of my Grandfathers served in World War II.  This film brings to life the events that lead up to "The Longest Day" and how it unfolded.  The battlefield secrets that were once hidden from us, held underwater for so long, are now revealed in incredible detail using today's modern technology.
"D Day's Sunken Secrets" is an indispensable documentary and should be shown in every US History classroom and to every future generation to educate, inspire and honor those bravest of soldiers who fought and often perished in this Great World War.
We just finished watching this on PBS. Now, guess what I'm in line to buy. A wonderful program on so many levels. Wow... just WOW.
very good informative programme

I was expecting a documentary about what had sunk during the D-Day invasion. Only one fourth to one third of the video deals with what is under water. The rest is general information about D-Day, even including the gliders and parachutists. The video is interesting, it just doesnt deal exclusively with what sank.

The back of the DVD case states that the video is 60 minutes long, but it is actually 112 minutes (Amazon says 120).

I would have given it five stars if more had been dedicated to what was beneath the sea.  I realize that you are talking about hallowed
ground but it would have been interesting if something could have been brought up for an inside examination or camera exploration.
Christmas gift
thanks good value fast ship
Fantastic story.  If you're a WWII buff, you'll love this DVD.
VERY GOOD STORY.

SAME TRIPE OVER AND OVER AGAIN. A TANK IS A TANK WETHER ON DRY LAND OR ID THE OCEAN. TO MAY OF THESE
TO SUITE ME.
Wonderful d-day story.  If you are looking for a program of underwater discovery like in the pacific his my not be for you. However a good purchase for historical purposes
bought for my husband who really loved the show when he watched it on tv, a whole new perspective of D-Day
fav movies!
Excellent history, never seen anything quite like it.. Must watch if one likes history...
We really enjoyed this movie.
So interesting and well done. I must have been sleeping during history class. This is so much better to watch a great documentary and get the real facts.
saw on PBS and wanted it for myself

This was extremely moving for me. My uncle was on LST-523 when it hit the mine near Normandy beach. His body was never recovered, so when the DVD showed the sunken ship I knew it was highly likely he was still onboard. I thought this documentary was well done and handled difficult situations with tremendous respect.
Another must-see chapter of that unimaginable war.  I was 18 mo. old when it started, but well remember through the years, asking my parents as I brought in the paper how the war was going.

Outstanding documentary of sunken allied military ships and equipment lost during the D Day invasion.  Explained military strategies used by both sides not commonly known. Fascinating insight of the Normandy invasion.
This is a must see for a first person accounting of D-Day.
Amazing. We learned so many things we didn't know.  A great mix of human interest and engineering marvels documented.  I cannot recommend it more highly.
